item.title: Hospitality: Bullying, low pay and burn-out blamed for staff shortage
item.description: As another popular Welsh restaurant closes its doors, what's next for the hospitality industry?

item.title: Give UK workers four more bank holidays a year, says TUC
item.description: The trades union body says having just eight public holidays in England and Wales is "stingy" .

item.title: Flood prevention: Swansea University study reveals role of wetlands
item.description: Vegetation can save up to £27m in avoided damage per estuary during a large storm, researchers say.

item.title: Police shut major Cardiff road after double stabbing
item.description: A key route in Cardiff city centre is closed on Sunday morning following a stabbing, police say.

item.title: Porthmadog: Drivers told to stop ignoring level crossing lights
item.description: Motorists in a coastal town are driving through flashing lights alerting them to oncoming trains.

item.title: Covid cases reach highest level in Wales since January
item.description: Despite rising cases, the number of people dying from Covid remains low according to figures.

item.title: Swansea reject Fulham bid for midfielder Matt Grimes
item.description: Swansea City reject an offer from Fulham for captain Matt Grimes ahead of Tuesday's transfer deadline.

item.title: Covid: Tooth loss fears over dentist check-up delays
item.description: The British Dental Association wants rules for dentists eased in Wales.

item.title: Welsh captain leads GB to first wheelchair rugby gold
item.description: Great Britain secure a tense 54-49 victory over the USA to win gold and secure their first wheelchair rugby medal at a Paralympic Games.

item.title: NHS blood test tube shortage: Doctors 'facing difficult choices'
item.description: Doctors call for more guidance after the NHS in England and Wales stops all non-urgent blood tests.

item.title: Shotton: Man charged with murder of Jade Ward , 27
item.description: Jade Ward was found dead at a property in Shotton, Flintshire, at about 09:30 BST on Thursday.

item.title: Snowdon: Amputee Paul Ellis' 13-hour crawl to reach summit
item.description: Paul Ellis, who had both his legs amputated in 2008, says the support of passers-by kept him going.

item.title: Risca HGV driver wins £275k McLaren supercar in raffle
item.description: A grandfather-of-three wins a McLaren 720S Spider after buying 40 tickets in a charity raffle.

item.title: Stormzy, Skepta and Aitch: Making beats for rap stars at 19
item.description: Chris Rich has made thousands from creating beats in the style of hip hop's elite.

item.title: Payday lenders: 'They are robbing the vulnerable'
item.description: Within months of his first £150 payday loan, Tom owed £6,000 to 10 lenders.

item.title: Snowdon: Amputee crawls up mountain to raise funds for children
item.description: It will be the first time Paul Ellis has made his way up a mountain after losing his legs in 2008.

item.title: North Wales tourism has strained communities, authority says
item.description: Snowdonia National Park Authority said numbers visiting brought benefits and challenges.

item.title: Scrapping theory tests could cut HGV driver shortage, says instructor
item.description: One lorry driving instructor said it can take up to 16 months to train up new drivers.

item.title: Covid: Stay outside for the bank holiday, minister urges
item.description: Health Minister Eluned Morgan said, amid rising case rates, people need to take precautions

item.title: Rubin Colwill: Wales midfielder signs new Cardiff City deal
item.description: Wales international Rubin Colwill signs a new contract which ties him to Cardiff City until the summer of 2024.

item.title: Danny Ward: Leicester City player can be a top keeper, says Wales coach Tony Roberts
item.description: Goalkeeping coach Tony Roberts on Wales, Wolves and Danny Ward's fight for game-time with club and country.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: 'Incredible Paralympic gold yet to sink in' - Jim Roberts
item.description: Great Britain wheelchair rugby player Jim Roberts says he will need a couple of days for their "incredible" Paralympic gold medal to sink in.

item.title: Glamorgan Cricket: County hit by Covid as Hundred players return
item.description: Glamorgan lose five players to Covid isolation before facing Essex in the Championship, as they welcome back four from the Hundred.

item.title: Ben Tozer: Ex-Cheltenham defender excited by Wrexham project
item.description: Ben Tozer on why he swapped League One club Cheltenham Town to join National League Wrexham.

item.title: Croesawu cyhoeddiad ar fesuryddion CO2 mewn ysgolion
item.description: Bydd y mesuryddion carbon deuocsid yn dangos os oes angen mwy o awyr iach yn yr ystafell ddosbarth.

item.title: Pryder bod pobl yn anwybyddu goleuadau rheilffordd Porthmadog
item.description: Pryder ym Mhorthmadog fod gyrwyr yn anwybyddu arwyddion croesfannau trenau gan achosi perygl sylweddol.

item.title: Gwlypdiroedd yn 'amddiffyniad natur rhag llifogydd'
item.description: Mae gwlypdiroedd arfordirol Cymru'n rhoi mwy o ddiogelwch rhag llifogydd na'r hyn a feddyliwyd.

item.title: Cofio'r ciws ar gopa'r Wyddfa... yn 1894
item.description: Yn ôl yr hanesydd Elin Tomos, mae Cymru yn denu ymwelwyr lu ers Oes Fictoria

item.title: Aur i dîm rygbi cadair olwyn Prydain yn Tokyo
item.description: Tîm Prydain, dan arweiniad y Cymro Jim Roberts, yn trechu'r UDA i ennill aur yn y Gemau Paralympaidd.
